content.raw:
This is the key difference between the two pull requests. On `default` I made the `Camera::Render` function virtual so that `UserCamera` can override the function. This in turns allows `UserCamera` to remove the render rate check that is in `Camera::Render`.

The result is that UserCamera assumes that `Render` is triggered at the correct time interval, and we don't have to multiply by 4 in order to overcome timing issues between QT and gazebo.
content.html:
This is the key difference between the two pull requests. On default I made the Camera::Render function virtual so that UserCamera can override the function. This in turns allows UserCamera to remove the render rate check that is in Camera::Render.

The result is that UserCamera assumes that Render is triggered at the correct time interval, and we don't have to multiply by 4 in order to overcome timing issues between QT and gazebo.
